title: Program Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at EngenderHealth
Interview Descriptions: I did my research about the org which paid off. There were 3 rounds with HR, project directors and the the program division director. The  interviews lasted 30 min to 1 hour each.  They were friendly and professional.
Interview Questions: Unfortunately, I don't remember the content of the questions but they were standard.

title: Operations Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at EngenderHealth (Johannesburg)
Interview Descriptions:
3 interview stages and assessments.
Difficult if you are not familiar with the NGO sector. Great in developing communication and negotiation and project management skills. Corporate governance and funding policies and procedures.
Interview Questions: Is it good to justify spending after money has been spent or during audit period?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at EngenderHealth
Interview Descriptions: Very good hiring and interview process. Interview process is very easy. Interview panel person is very easily understand of answer. Online interview process is very good.this is very good experience to me
Interview Questions: What is your past organization experience

title: Digital Communications Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at EngenderHealth
Interview Descriptions: They asked to interview a week after I sent in my application. They told me they wanted someone to stay on for at least 6 months (the listing initially said 12 weeks with the ability to extend) unpaid, which is unreasonable to ask during a pandemic. About a couple of days-a week later they asked if I could complete a social media test and said they would tell me their decision that Friday but instead they called me to tell me to interview for a different position which they then ghosted me for.
Interview Questions:
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
Why do you want to work at EngenderHealth?

title: General Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at EngenderHealth (Washington, DC) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: it was a good interview process .Before you meet candidates face-to-face, you need to figure out exactly what you’re looking for in a new hire so that you’re asking the right questions during the interview. Begin this process by “compiling a list of required attributes” for the position, suggests Fernández-Aráoz. For inspiration and guidance, Sullivan recommends looking at your top performers. What do they have in common? How are they resourceful? What did they accomplish prior to working at your organization? What roles did they hold? Those answers will help you create criteria and enable you to construct relevant questions.
Interview Questions: What do you see in yourself in 5 year

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at EngenderHealth (London, England) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Never got feedback on the outcome of the interview but the interviewers were nice and it was a comfortable interview. The questions were relatable and spoke to what i was applying for.
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at EngenderHealth (New York, NY) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: After a brief phone interview with an HR representative, I was invited for an in-office interview with the hiring managers.  I was then offered the position within a week and worked with HR to complete on-boarding paperwork.
Interview Questions: asked about past experience relevant to the position

title: Program Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at EngenderHealth (New York, NY) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I went through 3 rounds: HR,  hiring supervisor/manager, and the Program Director/Chief of Party. Overall, the process was typical and without any surprises.  The HR representative led me through the whole interview process. I came back twice for interviews.
Interview Questions: How would you work on the issue of HIV Prevention with a religious institution who did not accept condoms as a strategy?

title: Midcareer Staff Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at EngenderHealth (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Preliminary phone call from HR, followed by interviews on site with 6 people on the team and peripheral to the team. They were in groups of two. Standard interview questions, people were casual. It would be a neutral experience, except the recruiter never got back to me with yes or no (so no) even after that. Unprofessional, and may reflect organization structure. Salary at low end of my range, and my range is reasonable for the field.
Interview Questions: Why do you want go work here

title: Senior Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at EngenderHealth
Interview Descriptions: The Program Manager contacted me via email for a short general overview interview. I was lead through the requirements for the position and whether I was aware of the position's location and quantitative evaluation requirements.

title: Program Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at EngenderHealth (New York, NY) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted within several weeks of my CV submission.  Interview was pretty easy.  Asked for a writing sample and to have a conversation in French.  HR person (Anne) was very respectful.  Interviewers asked good questions and gave me the opportunity to ask questions
Interview Questions: Where do you want to be in 5 years.

title: Technical Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at EngenderHealth
Interview Descriptions: Contacted via email by the HR representative to set up the interview.  Came in to the office and met with the Team Leader and the Project Director.  The interview was long, most of the usual questions were asked, and they did quite a deal of the talking.  Later I was asked to submit a writing sample, where I wrote a concept paper.
Interview Questions: I was asked to present my skills in French
